newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's TV Azteca sees 33 pct ad market share '97.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's TV Azteca sees 33 pct ad market share '97.

text.p: Mexico's private television network TV Azteca on Wednesday estimated it would capture about a third of the country's total TV advertising market this year.

Mexico's total television ad market this year will be about $1.2 billion, company officials said at a television industry conference in Mexico City. They did not give comparative figures for the ad market last year.
"We estimate that TV Azteca will sell about $400 million in ad sales, about a third of the potential market," said Gustavo Guzman, vice-president of sales at Azteca.

Mexico's television market is dominated by Azteca and its more powerful rival, Grupo Televisa SA. However, since its privatization a few years ago, Azteca has steadily gained audience and ad market share.
Guzman said Azteca is considering making further moves in Central America, where it recently paid $15 million for a network in El Salvador.
"We plan to buy networks in other countries there in the same way we did in El Salvador," he said.
Azteca is already bidding for channels up for grabs in Guatemala, he said.
Azteca will present its ad plan for clients for 1998 on July 15, he added.
